{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.19911v1", "title": "Pick-up Sticks and the Fibonacci Factorial", "summary": "We present a variation of the broken stick problem in which $n$ stick lengths
are sampled uniformly at random. We prove that the probability that no three
sticks can form a triangle is the reciprocal of the product of the first $n$
Fibonacci numbers. Extensions to quadrilaterals and general $k$-gons are also
discussed.", "main_category": "math.PR", "categories": "math.PR", "published": "2025-04-28T15:40:35Z"}
